textbooks.title: Practical Multivariate Analysis
textbooks.author: Afifi, A., May, S., & Clark, V.

textbooks.title: Multivariate Data Analysis
textbooks.author: Joseph G. Hair, William C. Black, Barry J. Babin, Rolph E. Anderson

textbooks.title: Practical Statistics for Data Scientists: 50+ Essential Concepts Using R and Python
textbooks.author: Peter Bruce, Andrew Bruce, Peter Gedeck

textbooks.title: An Introduction to Statistical Learning: with Applications in R
textbooks.author: Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie, and Robert Tibshirani

topics: Lab 1: Pandas and Dataframe Manipulation in Python
Classification: Logistic Regression and Discriminant Analysis
Lab 3: Dimension Reduction and Classification using Python

grading.scale: C or above to pass the course
grading.policies: Late Policy: Each student is allowed to submit one DataCamp Assignment late. There will be a 50% grade penalty for late submissions beyond one. Quizzes cannot be completed late.

assignments.details: Due dates are specified on Canvas and certificates of completion to be submitted at Canvas; each DataCamp assignment takes about 4 hours to complete.
There is a multiple-choice quiz at Canvas with the deadlines specified on Canvas.

For the final assignment of the course, you will work on a dataset to analyze and answer several research questions. You will be expected to present your report and codes at Google Collab and upload a pdf print of it at Canvas.

policies.attendance: Attendance will be worth 5% of your final grade and will be evaluated as follows: 5/5: 0-2 missed classes; 3.5/5: 3-4 missed classes; 2/5: 5-6 missed classes; 0/5: 7+ missed classes.
policies.late_work: Each student is allowed to submit one DataCamp Assignment late. There will be a 50% grade penalty for late submissions beyond one. Quizzes cannot be completed late.
policies.academic_integrity: Consequences of academic impropriety are severe. The minimum sanction for any violation of the academic integrity code is an automatic 'F' grade for the course.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

important_dates: Thanksgiving Recess: No Classes; Offices Closed.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Python will be the programming language used for the course.
additional_info.support_resources: Student Counseling and Disability Services works with students to help achieve their academic and personal potential.

instructor.name: Dr. Somayeh Moazeni
instructor.office_hours: Tuesday 4:30 pm to 6:00 pm, Tuesday 9 pm to 9:30 pm, or by Appointment

_metadata.course_description: This course introduces basic theory and methods underlying multivariate analytics. Students will study techniques used for regression, classification, dimension reduction, and clustering.
learning_outcomes: understand the probability behind basic statistical models
use Python to analyze multivariate data
think critically about data and research findings
prerequisites: Linear Algebra (e.g., vector and matrix operation)
